    • Method Detail

      • updateProperty

        public static Result updateProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                    java.lang.String value,
                                    java.lang.String configID,
                                    java.lang.String noServiceException,
                                    boolean removeKeyForNullValue)
                             throws ServiceException
        Updates an already existing key. If multiple occurrences exist for this key, they will all be replaced by a single one containing the value provided here. All files will be affected; so if multiple files contained the key before the update, they will all contain one after the update.
        Parameters:
        key -
        value -
        configID -
        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.
        removeKeyForNullValue -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • updateProperty

        public static Result updateProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                    java.lang.String newValue,
                                    java.lang.String oldValue,
                                    java.lang.String configID,
                                    java.lang.String noServiceException,
                                    boolean removeKeyForNullValue)
                             throws ServiceException
        Updates an already existing key. All files containing the key will be affected.
        Parameters:
        key -
        newValue -
        oldValue - If not null, only those instances that match the old value will be updated. If multiple occurrences exist for this key, they will all be replaced by a single one containing the value provided here.
        configID -
        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.
        removeKeyForNullValue -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • updateProperty

        public static Result updateProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                    java.lang.String newValue,
                                    java.lang.String oldValue,
                                    java.lang.String configID,
                                    java.lang.String noServiceException,
                                    boolean removeKeyForNullValue,
                                    ConfigFilePersistMode mode,
                                    ConfigFile cfgFile)
                             throws ServiceException
        Updates an already existing key
        Parameters:
        key -
        newValue -
        oldValue - If not null, only those instances that match the old value will be updated
        configID -
        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.
        removeKeyForNullValue -
        mode - Determine which files are to be updated
        cfgFile - If mode is set to ConfigFilePersistMode.NAMED_FILE, the to-be-updated file must be provided here
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

        value -
        configID -

      • getPropertyValues

        public static java.lang.String[] getPropertyValues(java.lang.String key,
                                                   java.lang.String configID,
                                                   ConfigFile cfgFile,
                                                   java.lang.String noServiceException,
                                                   IData pipeline,
                                                   boolean ignoreGlobalValues,
                                                   boolean scanAllConfigurations,
                                                   boolean noVariableInterpolation,
                                                   boolean showEncryptedValues)
                                            throws ServiceException
        Return values for key.
        Parameters:
        key -
        configID - The name of the package from which to take the configuration. If null or an empty string, the package from which the call originated will automatically be determined
        configFile - If not null, use contents from the config file only; otherwise take entire package configuration
        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.
        pipeline - If a pipeline (IData) is provided, all values in the returned variables that are enclosed by a pair of "%" will be replaced by the respective content of the pipeline
        ignoreGlobalValues - If set to true, no attempt will be made to fall-back to the global values
        scanAllConfigurations - Should the key be searched in all configurations/files (true) or only values from the first "hit" be returned (false)?
        noVariableInterpolation - Should variable interpolation be suppressed (true, default) or not (false)?
        showEncryptedValues - Should the real value of an encrypted value be retrieved from the password store (true) or the logical handle be shown (false)?
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • getPropertyValues

        public static java.lang.String[] getPropertyValues(java.lang.String key,
                                                   java.lang.String configID,
                                                   java.lang.String noServiceException,
                                                   IData pipeline,
                                                   boolean ignoreGlobalValues,
                                                   boolean scanAllConfigurations,
                                                   boolean noVariableInterpolation,
                                                   boolean showEncryptedValues)
                                            throws ServiceException
        Return values for key.
        Parameters:
        key -
        configID - The name of the package from which to take the configuration. If null or an empty string, the package from which the call originated will automatically be determined
        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.
        pipeline - If a pipeline (IData) is provided, all values in the returned variables that are enclosed by a pair of "%" will be replaced by the respective content of the pipeline
        ignoreGlobalValues - If set to true, no attempt will be made to fall-back to the global values
        scanAllConfigurations - Should the key be searched in all configurations/files (true) or only values from the first "hit" be returned (false)?
        noVariableInterpolation - Should variable interpolation be suppressed (true, default) or not (false)?
        showEncryptedValues - Should the real value of an encrypted value be retrieved from the password store (true) or the logical handle be shown (false)?
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • getProperty

        public static java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.String configID)
        Wrapper around getPropertyValues(String, String, String, IData, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) for use from within Java code. Since v1.4.2 global values are ignored.
        Parameters:
        key - Property name or XPath expression
        configID - Config ID (i.e. name of IS package)
        Returns:
        first value for key/XPath; may be null if key is not defined or in case of error

      • getProperties

        public static java.lang.String[] getProperties(java.lang.String key,
                                               java.lang.String configID)
        Wrapper around getPropertyValues(String, String, String, IData, boolean, boolean, boolean, boolean) for use from within Java code. Since v1.4.2 global values are ignored.
        Parameters:
        key - Property name or XPath expression
        configID - Config ID (i.e. name of IS package)
        Returns:
        array of values for key/XPath; may be null if key is not defined or in case of error

      • getDocumentList

        public static IData[] getDocumentList(java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.String configID,
                                      ConfigFile cfgFile,
                                      java.lang.String[] arrays,
                                      java.lang.String noServiceException,
                                      boolean ignoreGlobalValues,
                                      boolean noVariableInterpolation,
                                      boolean showEncryptedValues)
                               throws ServiceException
        Return document list (IData array) for key.
        Parameters:
        key -
        configID - The name of the package from which to take the configuration. If null or an empty string, the package from which the call originated will automatically be determined
        configFile - If not null, use contents from the config file only; otherwise take entire package configuration
        arrays - A list of field names that are to be treated as arrays, even if only a single element is found
        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.
        ignoreGlobalValues -
        noVariableInterpolation -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

        Return document list (IData array) for key.

        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.

        arrays - A list of field names that are to be treated as arrays, even if only a single element is found
        noServiceException - Should an exception be thrown or the method return silently in case of an error? Takes a String argument rather than a boolean, so it is easier to pass through value from the invoking service. Use TRUE_STRING or FALSE_STRING in your own code.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

                                    ConfigFile cfgFile)
        Remove part of XML configuration
        Parameters:
        removeLocationXPath - XPath expression below which XML configuration shall be removed
        cfgFile - ConfigFile from which to remove content
        Returns:
        result of operation

      • interpolate

        public static java.lang.String interpolate(java.lang.String cfgId,
                                           java.lang.String value)
                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Interpolate string against active package configuration
        Parameters:
        cfgId - Name of package; if no configuration is found for this package, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        value - String with expression to interpolate
        Returns:
        interpolated string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no configuration is found for provided package name

      • getFileObjectForName

                                              java.lang.String fileName)
                                       throws ServiceException
        Return the actual ConfigFile object sitting behind a file name (absolute or relative)
        Parameters:
        configID - package name
        fileName - Absolute or relative file name to search for (absolute takes precedence)
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ServiceException

      • getConfigFilesAllOrCfgId

        public static ConfigFileList getConfigFilesAllOrCfgId(java.lang.String cfgId)
        Get list of either all config files or those belonging to a certain ID (i.e. package)
        Parameters:
        cfgId - Name of package for which to return files; may be null
        Returns:
        list of all config files (cfgId is null or an empty string) or only files belonging to given package
